meanings.definition: A white, crystalline powder used as a pain reliever.
meanings.sent1: I took an aspro to help with my headache.
meanings.sent2: The doctor prescribed an aspro for my back pain.
meanings.sent3: The aspro jumped out of the bottle and said, 'I'll make your pain disappear!'
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like an aspro, melting away the discomfort in the room.
meanings.sent5: The aspro sparkled in the sunlight, promising relief.

meanings.definition: A person who is sour or bitter in temperament.
meanings.sent1: She's such an aspro, always complaining about everything.
meanings.sent2: The old man down the street is known as the neighborhood aspro.
meanings.sent3: The little girl called her brother an aspro when he wouldn't share his toys.
meanings.sent4: His words were like an aspro, leaving a bitter taste in everyone's mouth.
meanings.sent5: The aspro's frown could sour milk, it was so intense.

meanings.definition: To make something white or pale in color.
meanings.sent1: She used bleach to aspro the stained shirt.
meanings.sent2: The artist decided to aspro the background of the painting.
meanings.sent3: The magician waved his wand and asproed the rabbit into a ghostly white.
meanings.sent4: The moonlight seemed to aspro the world, casting everything in a pale glow.
meanings.sent5: Her laughter seemed to aspro the room, filling it with lightness.
